sentence: Home improvement warehouse operator The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) on Friday received some bullish commentary from analysts at Bank of America/Merrill Lynch.
The firm maintained its "Buy" rating on HD and lifted its price target to $70.
That new target suggests a 24% upside to the stock's Thursday closing price of $56.55.
Bank of America/Merrill Lynch noted that the multi-year renovation cycle remains intact, hence the positive view.
Home Depot shares were mostly flat in premarket trading Friday.
Shares of Home Depot ( HD ) have a 2.05% dividend yield, based on last night's closing stock price of $56.55.
The stock has technical support in the $51-$52 price area.
If the shares can firm up, we see overhead resistance around the $60-$64 price levels.
The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) is not recommended at this time, holding a Dividend.com DARSâ„¢ Rating of 3.4 out of 5 stars.
